name: Louis Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night, in a "market deluxe" room. The room itself was great, spacious and well-designed (apart from the windows / curtains), with a view of the market. However, the curtains are placed about 2 feet from the two windows, and do not cover the whole area, which means that at the first light (around 5:30am onwards in Summer), the room becomes very bright. Because of the light we woke up at 6am and couldn't go back to sleep, which is very unfortunate when you are on holiday. This would be easy and inexpensive to fix, all the hotel has to do is install some blinds. In the morning we asked whether there was another room that was darker, and were told that all rooms have the same design of windows and curtains. We had booked for 5 nights but chose to leave after 1, because we didn't fancy waking up every day at 6am. They had the nerve to charge us for 80% of day 2, which was indeed according to their policy, but did not take account of the fact that their room design made it impossible for us to stay there.
reviews.title: If you want to wake up from bright light at 6am, this is the hotel for you!

reviews.text: Another issue we encountered was their restaurant level of service (Emiko Japanese restaurant). When we arrived in the evening we went down to the restaurant but there was no table so we decided to order room service. We were hungry already when we ordered. About an hour later the food was nowhere to be seen, and I called the restaurant. The manager said it was in process and it would arrive in 10-15 mins. In about 20 mins I called again, and by that point we were starving. I asked the restaurant manager when he thought we placed our order, and he said "half an hour ago". I said he should check the relevant slip, he said he did, and that's what he saw. The food eventually came around 90 mins after we placed our order, without ice cubes and without a dessert menu, as we had asked. We also needed steamed rice, but rather having to wait for god knows how long for it, we just had the food without it. Had a chat by phone with the hotel manager later on who said the restaurant was exceptionally busy that night, and deducted 50% of the meal bill. I'd rather have paid the full amount and have the food come in a reasonable time frame, and as ordered. The food itself was nothing special.
reviews.title: Munich Short Stay

reviews.text: Overall, great hotel with respect to location and infrastructure, pity about the level of service and also the lack of thoughtfulness in the design of the windows and curtains.
reviews.title: If location is important, don't hesitate to stay here!
Good one!
reviews.text: Hotel was well situated being close to transport, restaurants, shops and market. Room was a good size and very quiet overlooking internal courtyard. Wifi was free and worked well. Rooms and bathrooms could have had more amenities. Arrived and were quite jet lagged and the only room service available was japanese food. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Munich was a great place to visit.

The Louis Hotel is in a prime spot in Munich. If you leave out one door, you are in the market where you can find meat, cheese, wine, etc. If you leave out the other door, you can find more upscale shops and cafes. There are a million options for food, beer, and shopping right at your fingertips. The hotel itself is nice, if not a little on the steep side for price. The rooms were very clean and the sheets on the bed were probably the nicest I have found at any hotel. The bed was also very comfortable. The TV was very small and was not worth much more than background noise. The air was nice, but not American cold. You have to put your key in a slot in the room in order for the lights and air to come on, so you can't plan on having a cool room to come back to at night. The staff was incredibly accommodating. They were very helpful regarding directions, taxis, etc. The bar was also staffed by nice gentlemen. You do receive free WiFi, which is unusual, and an added bonus. It's not a strong signal but worked for the most part. I enjoyed my stay here and would stay again. Do not hesitate to book at this hotel if location is important to you.
reviews.title: Great location but problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very posh boutique hotel located on the Viktualienmarkt in Munich. Our room was very modern with beautiful hardwoods and furniture that (I believe) was designed specifically for the hotel! The beds were comfortable and typical of European style (two singles pushed together). We had a comfy sitting area in our room with a window that overlooked the market. The tv was small, but large enough for our needs, who watches tv on vacation anyways?! The bathroom was huge, no bath tub though, and the shower was just sectioned off from the rest of the bathroom with a shower curtain (very modern). The rain shower didn't work which made me sad, so we used the smaller hand held shower head. Wifi was speedy; there was also an in room safe.
reviews.title: Perfectly Posh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was amazing! There was such a large assortment of everything from rolls to meats, fruits, cereal (make sure you have the bircher muesli), as well as other options from the menu and an entire buffet of interesting modern breakfast items. Service for coffee and tea was nice, staff spoke English very well. I really looked forward to breakfast every morning!
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better location

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel, even though it was fairly pricey. The location itself is worth the money.
reviews.title: Great location, rooms and first rate staff

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, not great. However, the location couldn't be any better. The market is right outside the door of the hotel and the Marienplatz is a block away. We took took the train from the airport and walked 2 blocks to the hotel. Perfect, perfect location. The hotel restaurant was not that impressive.
reviews.title: Great hotel in fab location!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights with my family of 4. This is a superb location in central Munich, close to many sights and easy to get to from the airport on the S Bahn. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. Breakfast is really great. Look for a package because it's a little pricey otherwise. The staff was very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Horrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Munich and got to our original hotel (NOT Louis Hotel), which was a major disappointment. Small, cramped, hot room and the whole place smelled like an ashtray. The next day we moved to Louis Hotel and had the most amazing and relaxing stay in Munich! Hard wood floors, GIGANTIC bathrooms comfortable beds, Air COnditioning, little balcony overlooking Saint Peters, on and on and on. The service was marvelous!we asked for feather pillows and they delivered. It is centrally located in the Viktualien Market so we just ate fresh fruit and juice every morning with a wonderful danish from the bakery for breakfast.
reviews.title: Such an amazing hotel!

reviews.text: My ONLY complaint would be they get better wireless service going. The constant need for hard to remember passwords was a hassle. But a small price to pay for such great luxury in the center of town.
reviews.title: Perfect Spot in Munchen

reviews.text: We loved it!
reviews.title: Excellent location and great service

reviews.text: I found this hotel first after reading a NY Times article on design hotels (designhotels.com) and after reading a ton of Trip Advisor reviews on the Louis and other hotels, I selected the Louis based on the reviews, price, and location. My first cue that I had chosen wisely is when we came out of the Marienplatz train stop, we emerged into the Marienplatz (with the Glockenspiel chiming) and easily located the Louis less than a block away. The hotel decor is very pleasing and contemporary with a wonderful (included in our rate) breakfast (including a Japanese-based vegan full offering). The rooms were very nice, clean, and contemporary (matching the lobby decor). The staff was very helpful and cheerful at all times. The A/C was a little overmatched by the weather we were having (warm and humid at the time), but we asked for an electric fan and were accommodated as if we were staying at the Ritz Paris. I cannot say enough about the hotel's location - short walk to Hofbrau House and for that matter everything else you would want to see in Munich. We loved Munich and staying at the Louis was a key part of that experience. The value proposition was very, very good.
reviews.title: I do not understand the reviews

reviews.text: I love the decor - hardwood floors, beautiful and large bathroom. The hotel is very close to the farmers' market and the best shopping. S Baun etc. is easy distance. Great restaurants. Great cafes. ATM. Bookstore, etc
reviews.title: Perfect location in Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's the perfect location! Across the road from the Viktualen Markt, just around the corner from Marien Platz and the Kaufinger Staße shopping mall and right in the middle of many dining and pub options. And despite being in the heart of Munich, it is really quiet. It's a very stylish, very cool hotel. The service was excellent and very personal. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Stylish and perfectly located.

reviews.text: I have to admit that the location of the hotel is really ideal and I did really like the decor. BUT no matter how good location and style are, it does not compensate for the outrageous price I paid for 1 night. I won't even say how much, it makes me feel annoyed. They should be ashamed of themselves, especially as prices vary greatly depending on where and how you book. Very cheeky.
reviews.title: Disappointing and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There just were just not enough "touches" to make it feel worthwhile or to justify the price of a 5 star. The breakfast (not even included!!!) that I ended up paying 20 euros for was poor. I waited ages to be served coffee or tea. Again, for that price you would expect a lavish buffet, but no. I have stayed in nicer 3 stars for a fraction of the price.
reviews.title: Beyond The Call Of Duty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about the place was just so pretentious when really it is not worthy of it.
reviews.title: Amazing location and a great hotel that is quiet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really disappointed as I wanted to like it for that price and was expecting luxury, but just ended up feeling robbed.
reviews.title: Worth the $$$

description: Many great ideas arise from the heart. This is alsotrue for the LOUIS Hotel, located in the heart ofMunich, right on the Viktualienmarkt. The elegantKull & Weinzierl boutique hotel opened its doors inSeptember 2009 – panoramic view included.With one of the most prominent Munich sights right onits doorstep and the others in walking distance, theLOUIS Hotel is the perfect starting point to discover Munich’s opera, theatres, the Maximilianstraße, the Fünf Höfe shopping arcades and the many restaurants. In 72 rooms globetrotters feel at home. Carefully selected details and high quality materials create the perfect place to relax. The handcrafted interior is best described as elegant, high class, modern and relaxed – with great attention to detail. Handmade furnishings from nut and oak wood, natural stone and elegant tiling, that are reminiscent of the Parisian Metro, make your stay an unforgettable experience. There are two additional quite and bright meeting rooms with daylight and a japanese restaurant & bar EMIKO.
